neighbors.name: Penn Comm Of Game Commission
neighbors.claims: The Pennsylvania Game Commission (PGC) manages over 1.5 million acres of state game lands across the Commonwealth, fulfilling its mission to conserve wildlife habitat and provide recreational hunting grounds ([Times Observer](https://www.timesobserver.com/news/local-news/2024/02/game-commission-control-of-rural-land-worries-legislators/)). In Schuylkill County, the agency is a major landholder, owning parcels such as State Game Lands identified in tax records ([Schuylkill Parcel Locator](https://gis.vgsi.com/SchuylkillCountyPA/Parcel.aspx?pid=889)). While the Commission has established a 'Wind Energy Voluntary Cooperative Agreement' to guide developers in minimizing wildlife impacts on private land ([PA Game Commission](https://www.pa.gov/agencies/pgc/about-us/agency-business-center/wind-energy)), it has historically maintained a strict moratorium on wind turbine development directly on State Game Lands, citing incompatibility with habitat conservation ([Post-Gazette](https://www.post-gazette.com/powersource/policy-powersource/2018/04/27/pennsylvania-game-commission-wind-energy-ban/stories/201804270124)). Conversely, the agency has generated significant revenue from oil and gas leases on its properties, including in the Marcellus Shale region ([Marcellus Coalition](https://marcelluscoalition.org/energy-and-conservation-a-win-win-for-pennsylvanias-game-lands/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State agency with regulatory authority and extensive land holdings

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the Game Commission’s regional office regarding the Wind Energy Voluntary Cooperative Agreement and demonstrate strict adherence to wildlife habitat protections.

citations.claim: Manages over 1.5 million acres of state game lands
citations.title: Game Commission control of rural land worries legislators

citations.claim: Owner of parcels in Schuylkill County
citations.title: Schuylkill County Parcel Locator - Penn Comm Of Game Commission

citations.claim: Maintained a strict moratorium on wind turbine development on State Game Lands
citations.title: Wildlife agency says no to wind turbines on game lands

citations.claim: Established Wind Energy Voluntary Cooperative Agreement
citations.title: Wind Energy Voluntary Cooperative Agreement

citations.claim: Generated revenue from oil and gas leases
citations.title: Energy and Conservation: A Win-Win for Pennsylvania’s Game Lands

neighbors.name: Fanelli Limited Partnership I
neighbors.claims: Fanelli Limited Partnership I is a Pennsylvania business entity sharing an address with Fanelli Brothers Trucking Co. and Fanelli Warehousing in Pottsville, PA ([PA Bulletin](https://digitalcommons.law.villanova.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1040&context=pabulletin_2012)). The entity is affiliated with the Fanelli family, who are prominent local business owners; principal Frederick J. Fanelli is a high-profile attorney and former President of the Schuylkill County Bar Association ([Fanelli Evans Patel](https://www.feplawyers.com/attorney/frederick-j-fanelli/)). Frederick Fanelli previously represented Gladstone Partners in a zoning hearing regarding a proposed cargo airport in Schuylkill County, indicating experience with complex land use and development proceedings ([Aviation News](https://aviationacrossamerica.org/news/2012/09/09/cargo-airport-plan-resilient/)). The partnership owns property in the county but functions as a holding entity for the family's broader commercial interests ([Schuylkill Parcel Locator](https://gis.vgsi.com/SchuylkillCountyPA/Parcel.aspx?pid=68074)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Prominent local business family; principal is high-profile attorney

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Frederick J. Fanelli or the Fanelli Brothers corporate office; approach as a sophisticated commercial stakeholder familiar with zoning and land development.

citations.claim: Shares address with Fanelli Brothers Trucking Co.
citations.title: Pennsylvania Bulletin - Fanelli Limited Partnership I Address

citations.claim: Frederick J. Fanelli is a high-profile attorney and former Bar President
citations.title: Attorney Profile: Frederick J. Fanelli

citations.claim: Represented Gladstone Partners in zoning hearing for cargo airport
citations.title: Cargo Airport Plan Resilient
Schuylkill County Assessment - Fanelli Limited Partnership

neighbors.name: Thomas Milowicki
neighbors.claims: Thomas Milowicki is listed as a property owner in Barry Township, Schuylkill County, though records indicate he resides in southeastern Pennsylvania ([Schuylkill Planning](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/schuylkillcountypa/Document_Center/Departments/Planning%20&%20Zoning/Subdivision%20and%20Land%20Development/OLD-%20%20Approved%20Subdivision%20List%20Redone-%2010-29-2014.pdf)). He is the owner of Targetmaster, a firearms business and shooting range located in Chadds Ford, Delaware County, PA, as confirmed by administrative court filings ([PA Human Relations Commission](https://www.pa.gov/content/dam/copapwp-pagov/en/phrc/final-legal-orders/2021-present-final-orders/202101691%20targetmaster.pdf)). This confirms his status as an absentee landowner with primary business interests outside the local area.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee owner; primary business in Delaware County

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via direct contact (mail) focusing on factual project information, as he is an absentee owner with no known local civic involvement.

citations.claim: Listed as property owner in Barry Township
citations.title: Schuylkill County Approved Subdivision List

citations.claim: Owner of Targetmaster in Chadds Ford, PA
citations.title: PA Human Relations Commission Final Order - Targetmaster
